shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.
shorts.content: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: Lynnette’s Twirlerettes front-line performers and coaches
shorts.title_distilled: Lynnette’s Twirlerettes front-line performers and coaches.
shorts.description: Lynnette’s Twirlerettes front-line performers and coaches are representing nine school districts across three counties. First row, from left: Autumn Schafer, Wallenpaupack; Noah Marbert, Mr. Spartan, Mid Valley; and Aria Chludzinski, Old Forge. Second row: Isa DeGraffenreid, Wilkes-Barre; Casidy Montanya, West Scranton; Alexis Hoffman, Carbondale Area; and Martina McDonald, Carbondale Area. Third row: Nicolina Broskoskie, Carbondale, assistant coach; Emma DeNunzio, Western Wayne; Rylee Chaffin, North Pocono; Lily Thornton, Carbondale Area; and Selena McKitish, Carbondale head coach. Absent from photo: Courtney Comonie-Fino, Mid Valley head coach; Grace Anzulewicz, Lakeland; and Shiloh Muta, Miss Chief, Lakeland.
shorts.content: Lynnette’s Twirlerettes front-line performers and coaches are representing nine school districts across three counties. First row, from left: Autumn Schafer, Wallenpaupack; Noah Marbert, Mr. Spartan, Mid Valley; and Aria Chludzinski, Old Forge. Second row: Isa DeGraffenreid, Wilkes-Barre; Casidy Montanya, West Scranton; Alexis Hoffman, Carbondale Area; and Martina McDonald, Carbondale Area. Third row: Nicolina Broskoskie, Carbondale, assistant coach; Emma DeNunzio, Western Wayne; Rylee Chaffin, North Pocono; Lily Thornton, Carbondale Area; and Selena McKitish, Carbondale head coach. Absent from photo: Courtney Comonie-Fino, Mid Valley head coach; Grace Anzulewicz, Lakeland; and Shiloh Muta, Miss Chief, Lakeland.
shorts.content_distilled: Lynnette’s Twirlerettes front-line performers and coaches are representing nine school districts across three counties.

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: Old Forge, Dunmore in key battle to wrap up first-half
shorts.title_distilled: HS BASKETBALL: Old Forge, Dunmore in key battle to wrap up first-half.
shorts.description: The first half of the Lackawanna League concludes this week before teams transition to the new schedule format with play resuming Thursday. An intriguing matchup highlights the slate Tuesday when No. 6 Old Forge (10-3 overall, 5-1 division) plays at No. 1 Dunmore (13-1, 6-0) in Division II at 7:15 p.m. Dunmore owns a one-game lead in the Division II standings on the strength of its win at Riverside (13-1, 5-1). Old Forge is tied with Riverside for second place. This showdown concludes the three-team, round-robin in the first half. They will play again in the coming weeks. In addition […]
shorts.content: The first half of the Lackawanna League concludes this week before teams transition to the new schedule format with play resuming Thursday. An intriguing matchup highlights the slate Tuesday when No. 6 Old Forge (10-3 overall, 5-1 division) plays at No. 1 Dunmore (13-1, 6-0) in Division II at 7:15 p.m. Dunmore owns a one-game lead in the Division II standings on the strength of its win at Riverside (13-1, 5-1). Old Forge is tied with Riverside for second place. This showdown concludes the three-team, round-robin in the first half. They will play again in the coming weeks. In addition […]

shorts.title: HS SWIMMING NOTEBOOK: Scranton Prep had big day at Shartle Invitational
shorts.title_distilled: HS SWIMMING NOTEBOOK: Scranton Prep had big day at Shartle Invitational.
shorts.description: Scranton Prep’s talented group of swimmers had a rewarding weekend at the Ernie Shartle Invitational and are preparing for a strong finish to the regular season ahead of the important championship meets. Eva Kaszuba, a returning All-Region selection, set a meet record in the 100-yard breaststroke at the Shartle meet. Her winning time of 1 minute, 6.12 seconds also established a pool record at Tunkhannock High School. A dual-sport athlete in the winter who also excels at basketball, Kaszuba’s performance ranks her 14th overall in the state for the event based on data on paswimming.com. Last season, Kaszuba won an […]
shorts.content: Scranton Prep’s talented group of swimmers had a rewarding weekend at the Ernie Shartle Invitational and are preparing for a strong finish to the regular season ahead of the important championship meets. Eva Kaszuba, a returning All-Region selection, set a meet record in the 100-yard breaststroke at the Shartle meet. Her winning time of 1 minute, 6.12 seconds also established a pool record at Tunkhannock High School. A dual-sport athlete in the winter who also excels at basketball, Kaszuba’s performance ranks her 14th overall in the state for the event based on data on paswimming.com. Last season, Kaszuba won an […]
shorts.content_distilled: Scranton Prep’s talented group of swimmers had a rewarding weekend at the Ernie Shartle Invitational and are preparing for a strong finish to the regular season ahead of the important championship meets.

shorts.title: ATHLETE OF THE WEEK: Jordan Shaffer, Abington Heights basketball
shorts.title_distilled: ATHLETE OF THE WEEK: Jordan Shaffer, Abington Heights basketball.
shorts.description: The Abington Heights senior basketball player had 35 points, 10 rebounds and four blocks to lead the Comets to an 84-61 victory over Scranton Prep, the No. 1 team in The Times-Tribune Top 10 poll last week. He also had 20 points and 11 rebounds in the Comets’ 60-56 victory over No. 4 Valley View. Abington Heights now leads the Lackawanna League Division I standings, and climbed from No. 6 to No. 3 in The Times-Tribune poll. Shaffer has 989 career points. What did you think of your performance this week: As a team, we all knew what this week […]

shorts.title: Calligraphers’ Guild of NEPA 45th anniversary celebration
shorts.title_distilled: Calligraphers’ Guild of NEPA 45th anniversary celebration.
shorts.description: The Calligraphers’ Guild of NEPA recently celebrated its 45th anniversary at Colarusso’s Coal Fired Pizza restaurant. Attendees at the luncheon, front row, from left: Sister Cor Immaculatum Heffernan, I.H.M., honoree; Margie Zaums, charter member; and Sister Joan Paskert, I.H.M., guest. Second row: Mary Sadauckas, librarian; Annmarie Margotta, charter member and recording secretary; Melanie Lewis, exhibit chair; Jeanine Hanson; Patty Podesta, vice president; Livia Clark; Lisa Malos, historian; and Christine Brandt. Back row: Pam Graff, Kimberly Graff, Della Hutchison; Judy Jeanes, hospitality; Mary Schelble, Chris Medley; Debra Dick, workshop chair; Carol Moran; Ann Marie Castelgrande, treasurer; Rose Potter, Michael Bufalino; and […]

shorts.title: HS ROUNDUP: Jacklinski, Scranton girls get past Valley View
shorts.title_distilled: HS ROUNDUP: Jacklinski, Scranton girls get past Valley View.
shorts.description: Chrissy Jacklinski scored 22 points, including 11 in the first quarter and four in the fourth quarter, to lead the sixth-ranked Scranton to a 52-47 win over No. 5 Valley View on Monday in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball game. Rhylee Bell hit two 3-pointers and scored 16 points for the Lady Knights (4-3 league, 7-8 overall). Cora Castellani knocked down three 3-pointers and scored 15 points to lead No. 5 Valley View (5-2, 12-3). North Pocono 43, Delaware Valley 16: At North Pocono, Anna Clementoni scored 14 points and Ella Clementoni added 13 to lead the top-ranked […]

Rhylee Bell hit two 3-pointers and scored 16 points for the Lady Knights (4-3 league, 7-8 overall). Cora Castellani knocked down three 3-pointers and scored 15 points to lead No. 5 Valley View (5-2, 12-3).
